results.adx_keywords: Reading and Writing Skills (Education);Illiteracy;Dyslexia;Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Content Type: Personal Profile;Calkins, Lucy;Teachers College of Columbia University
results.title: In the Fight Over How to Teach Reading, This Guru Makes a Major Retreat
results.abstract: Lucy Calkins, a leading literacy expert, has rewritten her curriculum to include a fuller embrace of phonics and the science of reading. Critics may not be appeased.

media.caption: Lucy Calkins, an education professor, created a popular curriculum called “Units of Study,” built on a vision of children as natural readers and writers.
media.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Health Insurance and Managed Care;Hospitals;Surgery and Surgeons;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Supreme Courts (State);Decisions and Verdicts;Personal Finances;Credit and Debt;Centura Health;Colorado
results.title: She Was Told Surgery Would Cost About $1,300. Then the Bill Came: $229,000.
results.abstract: The Colorado Supreme Court ruled that Lisa French had never agreed to pay the full price when she signed service agreements with a hospital.

media.caption: “I was glad not just for me, but for other people,” Lisa French said about her court victory. “I think most people don’t get, like I didn’t get, how insurance and hospitals work.”
media.copyright: Helen H. Richardson/The Denver Post, via Associated Press

results.title: As Biden Signs $40 Billion Aid Package for Ukraine, Calls Grow for a Cease-Fire
results.abstract: But a diplomatic resolution to the war still looks remote, amid searing questions about what would constitute a “victory” for Kyiv.

media.caption: Volunteers working at a charity outside of Lviv, Ukraine, on Friday. The war has now lasted three months, and an outcome in the conflict is unclear.

results.title: Man Fatally Shot on Manhattan Subway in Unprovoked Attack
results.abstract: A gunman shot and killed Daniel Enriquez, 48, on a Q train in Lower Manhattan on Sunday. “It’s horrific, this is a horror movie,” his sister said.

media.caption: Daniel Enriquez, 48, was shot in the chest by a gunman while riding a Q train on Sunday.

results.title: Southern Baptist Leaders Mishandled Sex Abuse Crisis, Report Alleges
results.abstract: Executives of the nation’s largest Protestant denomination ignored victims, resisted reforms and were concerned with avoiding ‘potential liability,’ the third-party investigation says.

media.caption: A session of the Southern Baptist Convention’s annual meeting in Nashville, in June 2021.

results.title: Lara Logan, Once a Star at CBS News, Is Now One for the Far Right
results.abstract: The former chief foreign affairs correspondent is now a popular guest on podcasts hosted by vaccine skeptics and deniers of the 2020 election.

media.caption: Lara Logan in 2016. Some of her former CBS News colleagues recalled that when they worked together, her politics were not always easy to categorize.

results.adx_keywords: Preventive Medicine;Aspirin;Heart;Stroke;Blood Pressure;Elderly;your-feed-science;your-feed-health;American College of Cardiology;American Heart Assn;Journal of the American Medical Assn;United States Preventive Services Task Force
results.title: A Daily Aspirin Regimen May Hurt More Than Help, Experts Warn
results.abstract: Millions of Americans take aspirin to prevent a first heart attack or stroke. Now, doctors are advising against it — especially for people over 70.
org_facet: Journal of the American Medical Assn
United States Preventive Services Task Force

media.caption: A panel of experts reviewing data on a daily aspirin regimen to prevent heart attacks found that the net benefit for most Americans is very small and that the practice can carry real risks.

results.title: Lawyer Says He Dealt Directly With Trump Over Jan. 6 Plans
results.abstract: John Eastman said in a court filing that he had received handwritten notes from President Donald J. Trump as they strategized about how to keep him in power.

media.caption: John Eastman at a rally in Washington on Jan. 6, 2021. A new court filing underscored how instrumental he was in devising ways to fight Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s victory in the 2020 election.

results.title: U.S. Company Supplying Russian Military Seeks Exit, Caught Between Sanctions and Kremlin
results.abstract: Arconic runs a huge Russian metal plant, bought in an era of cooperation between the U.S. and Russia. Now it is struggling, after years of increasing Russian military aggression.

media.caption: The Alcoa and Arconic headquarters in Pittsburgh in January. Arconic is a Fortune 500 company that is one of America’s largest metalworking firms.

results.abstract: Under current New York State law, landlords are not required to offer new leases to market-rate tenants. That could soon change.
